name: phq9
title: Patient Health Questionnaire-9 (PHQ-9)
description: The PHQ-9 is a multipurpose instrument for screening, diagnosing, monitoring and measuring the severity of depression.

questions: Little interest or pleasure in doing things
Trouble falling asleep, staying asleep, or sleeping too much
Feeling tired or having little energy
Feeling bad about yourself - or that you’re a failure or have let yourself or your family down
Trouble concentrating on things, such as reading the newspaper or watching television
Moving or speaking so slowly that other people could have noticed. Or, the opposite - being so fidgety or restless that you have been moving around a lot more than usual
Thoughts that you would be better off dead or of hurting yourself in some way

form.scoringInfo: PHQ-9 score obtained by adding score for each question (total points)

headline.text: The PHQ-9 is a multipurpose instrument for screening, diagnosing, monitoring and measuring the severity of depression.

interpretation.title: Interpretation
interpretation.text:
• Total scores of 5, 10, 15, and 20 represent cutpoints for mild, moderate, moderately severe and severe depression, respectively.
  • Note: Question 9 is a single screening question on suicide risk. A patient who answers yes to question 9 needs further assessment for suicide risk by an individual who is competent to assess this risk.

supplemental.title: Provisional Diagnosis and Proposed Treatment Actions
supplemental.text:
PHQ-9 Score: 0–4

Depression Severity: None–minimal
Proposed Treatment Actions: None

PHQ-9 Score: 5–9

Depression Severity: Mild
Proposed Treatment Actions: Watchful waiting; repeat PHQ-9 at follow-up

PHQ-9 Score: 10–14

Depression Severity: Moderate
Proposed Treatment Actions: Treatment plan, considering counseling, follow-up and/or pharmacotherapy

PHQ-9 Score: 15–19

Depression Severity: Moderately Severe
Proposed Treatment Actions: Active treatment with pharmacotherapy and/or psychotherapy

PHQ-9 Score: 20–27

Depression Severity: Severe
Proposed Treatment Actions: Immediate initiation of pharmacotherapy and, if severe impairment or poor response to therapy, expedited referral to a mental health specialist for psychotherapy and/or collaborative management
